topics.body: [spoiler]I know that I sound like a Broken record, But while I understand why Evangelion is considered to be revolutionary, I just don't like what it represents in the general anime fandom. (Also, I think Gunbuster sounds like a much stronger story anyway.)[/spoiler]

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a1f4056368721538771d00#post_54a1f4056368721538771d00
While the religious imagery is kind of pointless for the most part, (They aren't really saying anything for the most part) I agree with you on the other two aspects.

General anime fans praising it for revolutionizing things that it didn't really revolutionize is my main issue. On It's own merits, I admit that It is very great, However I think that the Mainstream anime fandom has blown Everything related to EVA way out of proportion. (I remember EVAfags shitting on Pacific rim for somehow being "An Evangelion knockoff")
